recipeIngredient: 3 lbs starchy potatoes  ((for example Russet or Yukon Gold))
2 cups unsweetened almond or soy milk

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 °F. Peel the potatoes and thinly slice them. Generously grease a baking dish with vegan butter or margarine.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 375 °F. Peel the potatoes and thinly slice them. Generously grease a baking dish with vegan butter or margarine.

recipeInstructions.text: Now make the sauce. Combine all of the ingredients for the sauce in a high speed blender and blend until smooth. Spread about half of the potato slices into the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
recipeInstructions.name: Now make the sauce. Combine all of the ingredients for the sauce in a high speed blender and blend until smooth. Spread about half of the potato slices into the bottom of the prepared baking dish.

recipeInstructions.text: Top with about half of the sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Top with about half of the sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the onion into thin slices. Heat some oil in a pan and sauté the onion for about 3 minutes. After 2 minutes add the garlic. Equally divide the onion and the garlic on the first layer of potatoes.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the onion into thin slices. Heat some oil in a pan and sauté the onion for about 3 minutes. After 2 minutes add the garlic. Equally divide the onion and the garlic on the first layer of potatoes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add a second layer of potatoes with the remaining potatoes. Top with the remaining sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Add a second layer of potatoes with the remaining potatoes. Top with the remaining sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Generously top with vegan shredded cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: Generously top with vegan shredded cheese.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 50 minutes. Cover with aluminium foil towards the end of the baking time if the top gets too dark. Sprinkle with freshly chopped chives and serve immediately.
